snippet: Federal officials said they would give states wide discretion on details, but would set up and operate exchanges if states refused to do so.
abstract: Obama administration will issue standards for health insurance exchanges, markets where consumers and small businesses will be able to buy coverage from competing private plans, a major provision of the new health care law; federal officials say they will give state officials broad discretion to decide the operational details, but make clear they will set up and operate an exchange in any state that refuses to do so.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials said they would give states wide discretion on details, but would set up and operate exchanges if states refused to do so.

headline.seo: Obama Administration to Set Health Care Exchange Rules
headline.main: Health Care Exchange Rules to Be Set
headline.print_headline: Health Care Exchange Rules to Be Set

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
